snippet: Sixty-five percent said the decision to bar the Clippers’ owner from the N.B.A. for life and fine him $2.5 million was appropriate response to his racist comments, a New York Times/CBS News poll found.
abstract: New York Times/CBS poll finds wide support for actions taken by the NBA against Los Angeles Clippers owner Donald Sterling, with 65 percent supporting measures; poll does find deep racial divide among basketball fans, with majority of black fans saying racist beliefs are prevalent among NBA owners, while only 19 percent of white fans agreed.
lead_paragraph: Sixty-five percent said the decision to bar the Clippers’ owner from the N.B.A. for life and fine him $2.5 million was appropriate response to his racist comments, a New York Times/CBS News poll found.

headline.main: Despite Racial Divides, Poll Finds Wide Support for Sterling’s Penalties
headline.print_headline: Despite Racial Divides, Poll Finds Wide Support for Sterling’s Penalties
